required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study in Adult and Adolescent Subjects With PAR (Perennial Allergic Rhinitis)
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Phase 3 Clinical Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol (320 Mcg, Once Daily) in the Treatment of Perennial Allergic Rhinitis (PAR) in Adult and Adolescent Subjects (12 Years of Age and Older)

lead_sponsor.agency: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the efficacy and safety of an investigational nasal aerosol compared with placebo nasal aerosol in the treatment of perennial allergic rhinitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Days -3 to 0) and Days 1-43 (6-week Treatment Period)
primary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, awareness, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (sign/symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Days -3 to 0) and Days 1-43 (6-week Treatment Period)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the 10 minutes prior to assessment twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of symptoms, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ)
secondary_outcome.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains (activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, eye symptoms, and emotional). Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Least severe to 6 = Extremely severe). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses, and ranges from 0 to 7. A negative change from Baseline score indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: During the 6-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 µg BDP HFA once daily.
During the 6-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily.

intervention.intervention_name: Beclomethasone dipropionate hydrofluoroalkane HFA Nasal Aerosol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed Consent
- Documented history of perennial allergic rhinitis
- A demonstrated sensitivity to at least one allergen known to induce PAR through a standard skin prick test.
- Minimum subject-reported reflective total nasal symptom score (rTNSS) of at least 6 (out of a possible 12)
- Other criteria apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of physical findings of nasal pathology (within 60 days prior to screening visit)
- Participation in any investigational drug study 30 days preceding screening visit
- History of respiratory infection/disorder with 14 days preceding screening visit or during the run-in period
- Use of any prohibited concomitant medications

overall_official.affiliation: Teva Branded Pharmaceutical Products, R&D Inc.

results_reference.citation: Meltzer EO, Jacobs RL, LaForce CF, Dorinsky PM, Kelley L, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK (2011). BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol 320 µg Once Daily Is Safe and Effective in the Treatment of Nasal Symptoms Associated With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol. 107(11):A118.

Meltzer EO, Jacobs RL, LaForce CF, Dorinsky PM, Kelley L, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK. . BDP HFA Nasal Aerosol 320 µg Once Daily Is Safe and Effective in the Treatment of Nasal Symptoms Associated With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis. Ann Allergy Asthma Immunol (Supplement); 107(11):A118 - Poster presentation.

Carr W, Meltzer EO, Finn A, Dorinsky PM, Kelley L, Dunbar SA, Tantry SK. Effective nasal symptom relief and improvement in health-related quality of life in subjects with perennial allergic rhinitis following 6-week

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 675 patients were screened and 574 patients were enrolled in the study and participated in the Run-in Period. Of the 574 enrolled patients, 474 were randomized to study treatment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the 7 to 21 day Run-in Period, participants self-administered a single-blind placebo nasal aerosol once daily in the morning and assessed and recorded their twice daily allergic rhinitis symptoms to determine eligibility for randomization.

group.title: BDP HFA 320 µg/Day
group.description: During the 6-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered 4 actuations (two per nostril) of 80 micrograms (µg) beclomethasone dipropionate (BDP) hydrofluoroalkane (HFA) once daily.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: During the 6-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily.

participants_list.participants: Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline assessment.
Participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had at least 1 post-baseline assessment.

group.description: During the 6-week double-blind Treatment Period participants self-administered four actuations (two per nostril) of placebo HFA once daily.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Demographic data are provided for the Intent to Treat population.

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: A participant may select more than one race type.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, awareness, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (sign/symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Days -3 to 0) and Days 1-43 (6-week Treatment Period)
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population: The ITT population included all randomized patients who received at least one dose of randomized study medication and had at least one post-baseline assessment.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Reflective Total Nasal Symptom Score (rTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
measure.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the past 12 hours twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, awareness, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of sign/symptom, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (sign/symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population: The ITT population included all randomized patients who received at least one dose of randomized study medication and had at least one post-baseline assessment.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05
analysis.method_desc: The repeated measures ANCOVA included covariate adjustment for baseline, day, treatment, and the treatment by day interaction.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the 10 minutes prior to assessment twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of symptoms, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Average AM and PM Instantaneous Total Nasal Symptom Score (iTNSS) Over the Six-week Treatment Period
measure.description: Participants recorded the severity of their nasal symptoms (sneezing, runny nose, itchy nose and nasal congestion) over the 10 minutes prior to assessment twice daily (AM & PM) using the following scale: 0=absent (no sign/symptom); 1=mild (sign/symptom present, easily tolerated); 2=moderate (awareness of symptoms, bothersome but tolerable); 3=severe (symptoms hard to tolerate, interfere with daily activities and/or sleeping). The total nasal symptom score (sum of the 4 symptom scores) ranges from 0 to 12 (worst symptoms). A negative change from Baseline score indicates symptom improvement.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05
analysis.method_desc: The repeated measures ANCOVA included covariate adjustment for baseline, day, treatment, and the treatment by day interaction.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ)
outcome.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains (activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, eye symptoms, and emotional). Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Least severe to 6 = Extremely severe). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses, and ranges from 0 to 7. A negative change from Baseline score indicates improvement.
outcome.population: The RQLQ population included adults (18 years and older) with an impaired quality of life at Baseline as defined by a RQLQ score at the Randomization Visit of 3.0 or greater.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Rhinoconjunctivitis Quality of Life Questionnaire (RQLQ)
measure.description: The adult RQLQ has 28 questions in 7 domains (activities, sleep, non-nose/eye symptoms, practical problems, nasal symptoms, eye symptoms, and emotional). Participants were asked to recall their experiences during the previous week and to give their responses on a 7-point scale (0 = Least severe to 6 = Extremely severe). The overall RQLQ score is the mean of all 28 responses, and ranges from 0 to 7. A negative change from Baseline score indicates improvement.
measure.population: The RQLQ population included adults (18 years and older) with an impaired quality of life at Baseline as defined by a RQLQ score at the Randomization Visit of 3.0 or greater.

analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance is p<0.05
analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA with treatment, baseline and center in the model.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor has the right 60 days before submission for publication to review/provide comments. If the Sponsor’s review shows that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure shall be delayed for up to 90 additional days in order for the Sponsor, or Sponsor’s designees, to file the necessary patent applications. In multicenter trials, each PI will postpone single center publications until after disclosure or publication of multicenter data.
